examples: Huge chimneys belched forth smoke and grime.
Water gushed forth from a hole in the rock.
The film cuts back and forth between the two stories.
The fourth of July is Independence Day in the US.
A fourth of the ski resorts in the Alps may not have enough snow this year.

meanings.def: used at the end of a list to show that it continues in the same way
examples: We discussed everything—when to go, what to see and so on.

meanings.def: from one place to another and back again repeatedly
examples: ferries sailing back and forth between the islands

meanings.def: beginning on that day; from that time
examples: From that day forth she gave me endless friendship and encouragement.

idioms.def: used at the end of a list to show that it continues in the same way
examples: We discussed everything—when to go, what to see and so on.

idioms.def: from one place to another and back again repeatedly
examples: ferries sailing back and forth between the islands

idioms.def: beginning on that day; from that time
examples: From that day forth she gave me endless friendship and encouragement.

meanings.def: a river that flows through central Scotland into the North Sea. The long wide area of water where the Forth flows into the sea is called the firth of Forth, and is well known for the Forth Bridges.
